originalTitle: Thirteen schoolchildren killed after bus collides with lorry in South Africa

content: The fatal collision is just the latest in South Africa, where the road safety record is poor.

content: Mozambique President Daniel Chapo cancels a trip to Davos due to severe floods in the country

content: BBC Africa Eye joins an anti-trafficking police unit in Sierra Leone helping a man look for his missing children.

originalTitle: In Iran, the US-Israeli addiction to hybrid warfare is on full display

content: Hybrid war tactics help explain why Trump’s strategy oscillates between threats of war and false offers of peace.

originalTitle: Yemen faces worst food crisis since 2022, aid group warns
title: Yemen faces worst food crisis since 2022, aid group warns
content: Aid cuts, conflict and economic collapse push millions of Yemenis towards severe hunger in 2026.

content: Keir Starmer said Donald Trump’s threats to impose tariffs on allies over Greenland are ‘completely wrong’.

originalTitle: High-speed train crash in Spain kills at least 39
title: High-speed train crash in Spain kills at least 39
content: More than 400 passengers were on board the trains that derailed near the city of Córdoba, in Spain's worst rail crash in more than a decade.

content: Passengers recount the moment two trains collided between Málaga and Madrid on Sunday evening.

originalTitle: Trump links Greenland dispute to not getting Nobel Peace Prize
title: Trump links Greenland dispute to not getting Nobel Peace Prize
content: The US president says he no longer feels obliged to think only of peace, after not being awarded the annual prize.

originalTitle: Is a Panenka ever the right choice for a penalty?
title: Is a Panenka ever the right choice for a penalty?
content: Following Morocco's last-minute spot-kick miss in the Africa Cup of Nations final, BBC Sports asks if a Panenka is ever the right choice for a penalty.

originalTitle: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's Afcon triumph
title: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's Afcon triumph
content: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations after the final is overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play.

originalTitle: Dalot 'would have been given red card in Europe'
title: Dalot 'would have been given red card in Europe'
content: Manchester United's Diogo Dalot was not sent off against Manchester City after his foul on Jeremy Doku was "glancing" contact.
